page.title: 15THE ALLOTMENTS
page.content: The allotments were made in 1939,just before the Second World War began. There used to be allotments on Ridge Balk Lane but these were destroyed when the New Estate was built.The allotments were mainly for people to grow their own vegetables during the war.Each allotment is approximately 495square metres.To rent an allotment it costs Â£9.00 per year and altogether there are ninety allotments.Some of the men there keep pigeons,some have goats,chickens,hens or rabbits.They grow many things such as brussel sprouts,cucumbers,peas, potatoes,onions,beetroot,cabbage and lettuce.Many retired men keep them to occupy their minds aswell as for enjoyment.
